items.abstract:
<jats:title>Abstract</jats:title>
<jats:p>Primary reference measurement procedure for Cr determination in biological samples by radiochemical neutron activation analysis (RNAA) has been elaborated. The procedure is based on quantitative and selective separation of chromium from neutron irradiated sample by column chromatography using MnO<jats:sub>2</jats:sub>-Resin and determination of <jats:sup>51</jats:sup>Cr by γ-ray spectrometry. Quality components have been incorporated into the RNAA method which makes it possible to meet the requirements of the definition of ratio primary reference measurement procedure. The usefulness of the elaborated procedure to assign the certified values for Cr in new certified reference material (CRMs) based on animal tissues is demonstrated. The tentative certified values for Cr have been proposed for: MODAS M-4 Cormorant Tissue and M-5 Cod Tissue CRMs.</jats:p>
title: Ratio primary reference measurement procedure (RPRMP) for the certification of chromium content in biological reference materials
